insights.title: Spending collapsed to zero
insights.observation: Your total spend dropped from $2,480,625 in the previous 90‑day period to $0 this period – a 100% decline.
insights.recommendation: Investigate the root cause (e.g., budget freeze, contract expiration, system outage) and re‑activate purchasing processes where appropriate.

insights.title: Supplier base vanished
insights.observation: You went from 1 active supplier in the prior period to none now, representing a 100% reduction in supplier count.
insights.recommendation: Review contract statuses and onboarding pipelines to ensure at least one qualified supplier is available for critical items.

insights.title: Current spend far below industry norm
insights.observation: Your $0 spend this period is 100% lower than the industry median spend of $531,781 and 100% lower than the 75th‑percentile benchmark of $9.4 M.
insights.recommendation: If the low spend is intentional (e.g., seasonal lull), document the plan; otherwise, align procurement activities with business demand to avoid missed opportunities.

insights.title: Supplier count well under benchmark
insights.observation: Having zero active suppliers this period puts you at the bottom of the distribution (industry average 3.7 suppliers, 25th‑percentile 1).
insights.recommendation: Develop a supplier diversification strategy to maintain at least the industry median of 3‑4 active suppliers, reducing supply‑risk exposure.

insights.title: Historical spend dramatically higher than peers
insights.observation: Your historical 90‑day spend of $2.48 M is ~4.6× the industry median ($531 k) and ~62× the 25th‑percentile ($42 k), indicating a very high spend concentration relative to peers.
insights.recommendation: Leverage this buying power to negotiate volume discounts or explore competitive bidding to bring unit costs closer to market levels.

insights.title: Extreme product and supplier concentration
insights.observation: All of your historical spend (100%) was on a single product (Almond House Apricot 500 g), within one category (Dried apricots), from one supplier (A one Precision Tools Center). Industry buyers typically source 2‑3 items from multiple suppliers.
insights.recommendation: Conduct a category‑risk assessment and identify alternative sources or substitute products to mitigate dependency on a single SKU and supplier.
